Princeton ACM

The official website for the Princeton University student chapter of the Association for Computing Machinery.

Jeffrey Yan

Hi,

My name is Jeffrey Yan and I am an ORFE major. I am looking for a Web/App developer for my startup. I have already done a decent amount of work on it.

I would like to get a minimum viable product (basic app/website testing product) out before November in time for restaurant week in Princeton. I am looking for someone who is adept at javascript, html, css, php (or any other server-side language), or objective c. This app has to do with food, so if you like food and enjoy coding, you should definitely message me. The startup will be a big task, so I need someone who can devote a considerable amount of time to this. It will also be extremely rewarding.

If you're interested, please email me at jy6@princeton.edu. We will have a one on one meeting to discuss more specific details. Thanks!

Best Regards, Jeffrey Yan

September 25, 2013

Blander

---------------------------------------------------------

Building a Quant Trading Startup with a World-Class Research Culture

---------------------------------------------------------

Presented by Blander Technologies founder and CEO, Ben Blander, math Ph.D and former head of Citadel’s high-frequency group

WEDNESDAY, SEPTEMBER 25

6:00 PM

LEWIS LIBRARY 138

DINNER PROVIDED FROM OLIVES

To help us order enough food, please RSVP at

http://tinyurl.com/princetonquantstartupsept25

ALL MAJORS & CLASS YEARS WELCOME

----------------------------------

What you'll learn

----------------------------------

- why high-frequency trading is in decline and research-based trading is on the rise

- what you’ll have to learn and unlearn to become a leader in the trading industry

- the advantages and challenges of starting a trading firm from scratch

- how the opportunity of a quant trading startup stacks up to software startups

--------------------------------------

about Blander Technologies

--------------------------------------

Blander Technologies is a research-driven, proprietary trading firm in Chicago.

We’re an emerging startup led by Ben Blander, former head of Citadel’s high frequency group and a key contributor in growing their P&L from $75 million in 2005 to $1.15 billion in 2008 (Source:

http://www.institutionalinvestor.com/Popups/PrintArticle.aspx?ArticleID=2593339)

Previously Ben earned a PhD in Math from the University of Chicago.

We’re building a new type of trading firm dedicated to research through open, collaborative innovation. All our associates operate from somewhere on the continuum between these two roles:

 

- Technologists: Your goal is to enable alpha generation and improve the research infrastructure through technology innovation. You’ll also be expected to have a strong interest in understanding and contributing to our trading strategies.

- Quantitative researchers: While the focus is on identifying trading opportunities, you can add even more value with strong communication skills and some coding proficiency to accelerate the innovation process and help others leverage your work.

------------------------------

WHY TRADING?

------------------------------

If you want to work with huge data sets and cutting-edge technology to solve really tough problems, while getting near-immediate feedback on your best ideas, the trading industry is hard to beat. Every day we’re competing with some of the smartest, most driven people in the world trying to take your money -- and if you don’t stay at the very top of your game in research, technology, and economics, they will.

And while the highly-publicized wave of high-frequency or “flash” trading based on sheer speed of execution might have reached its limit, we see continued opportunities with our strategy of using statistical research to outsmart the competition.

--------------------------------------

Hope to see you this Wednesday, September 25th. To help us order enough food, please RSVP at

http://tinyurl.com/princetonquantstartupsept25

QUESTIONS? Contact Quentin Ybarra

quentin.ybarra@blandertechnologies.com

SQL on Steroids

Hey ACM,

Come join us for dinner this Saturday, Sept 21, at 5:30 in Sherrerd Hall (3rd floor) for a tech talk with MemSQL, one of the hottest data analytics startups in Silicon Valley, about the future of big data and how they borrowed ideas from Facebook's infrastructure to build the world's fastest database.
Pizza and refreshments will be served. RSVP here to attend. Hope to see y'all there!
Momchil

September 18, 2013

Tower Research


Tower Research Capital LLC, a high-frequency proprietary trading firm founded in 1998, continues to enhance the in-house trading system and strategies that have positioned the firm as a leader in the thriving field of quantitative trading. Today, Tower’s robust, resilient, and blindingly fast system enables the firm to execute algorithmic trading strategies based on patterns in market behavior. While Tower offers challenges and rewards rivaling those of any Wall Street firm, Tower’s laid-back work environment reflects the premium the firm places on quality of life.

Tower will be hosting an Information Session on Tuesday, September 24 (5:00 p.m. to 6:00 p.m. in Frist 302). All are welcome to attend to learn more about the firm, discuss full-time and internship opportunities, and enjoy free food from Olives, as well as Tower t-shirts and backpacks!

This year, we are recruiting top-tier graduating students for our full-time Infrastructure Developer and Quantitative Trader positions, as well as promising underclassmen for our development and trading internships. I encourage you to read more about Tower and our open positions at www.tower-research.com.

To apply, please submit your resume online through TigerTracks or email it to apply@tower-research.com by Thursday, September 26. 

September 17, 2013

InstaEDU

My name is Sophie and I am the community manager at an online tutoring company called InstaEDU which provides a great part-time job opportunity for students at Princeton.

InstaEDU tutors earn money by teaching online at any time of the day or night. Whenever you’re online, we send student requests your way. If you're available, just accept and you’ll instantly launch into a tutoring session. You can also set up scheduled lessons when it's convenient for you. We track your hours tutored -- $20/hr -- and pay you every day.

Signing up is easy. Just visit http://instaedu.com/become-a-tutor and follow a few simple steps. The whole process will take you less than 10 minutes.

September 17, 2013
